history.content:
I've heard CS161 has relatively lighter course loads; tbh can't think of any other upper-divs with really light courseloads, maybe look at technical electives like Math 110 for light electives? 

------

I've heard CS 160 is light as well, though the project in the end could get heavy. CS 186 is definitely not 'easy', while the exams/material is not that difficult, the projects require significant effort.

In general, CS classes are not easy lol

-----

I wouldn't call 186 easy but the projects are not 'difficult': if you keep up with lectures and know what you're doing they take around 6-10 hours. (They also give you 1-2 weeks to complete each project)

I've heard CS161 has relatively lighter course loads; tbh can't think of any other upper-divs with really light courseloads, maybe look at technical electives like Math 110 for light electives? 

------

I've heard CS 160 is light as well, though the project in the end could get heavy. CS 186 is definitely not 'easy', while the exams/material is not that difficult, the projects require significant effort.

In general, CS classes are not easy lol

I've heard CS161 has relatively lighter course loads; tbh can't think of any other upper-divs with really light courseloads, maybe look at technical electives like Math 110 for light electives? 

------

I've heard CS 160 is light as well, though the project in the end could get heavy.
I've heard CS161 has relatively lighter course loads; tbh can't think of any other upper-divs with really light courseloads, maybe look at technical electives like Math 110 for light electives?

What are some easy CS/EE upper div with light course load (comparatively)?

I already took CS188. I heard CS186 is easy, but some students taking it this semester say that the course got redesigned so it's actually hard now?

I want to take next semester as easy as possible. Any input is appreciated, thanks!
history.subject: Easy CS/EE upper div recommendation
